title: Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
subhead: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

title: Audenge, home to Europe's largest seawater swimming pool
subhead: 'Aquatic Monuments' (3/6). Le Monde brings you to French public pools with exceptional architecture. In the Landes de Gascogne Regional Natural Park, a former 19th-century hunting basin has become the largest seawater swimming pool in Europe. Since the 1920s, residents of Audenge and neighboring towns have come here for swimming lessons, to enjoy oysters, and to relax in the shade of towering trees.

title: Nan Goldin, photographer: 'The camera gave me a voice, and a way in'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be here if...' Each week, Le Monde asks a public figure about a decisive moment in their life. The American photographer reflects on her sister's suicide, which changed her view of the world.

title: Economist Gabriel Zucman: 'France's new PM will have to address the proposed tax on the ultra-rich'
subhead: Zucman is the architect behind the proposal to tax the wealthiest individuals, a measure championed by the left. 'It will be very difficult to ask the French people to make sacrifices as long as billionaires pay so little in taxes,' he told Le Monde in an interview.
byline: Interview by Denis Cosnard and Pascal Riché

title: A new exhibition brings the Paris suburbs from the outside to the forefront
